reviews_name: Mobile with great potential but with little bit of compromise
reviews_text:
I am using this model for just over 1 month. Here is my experience with this phone.
Pros:
1. It is smooth. Like really smooth performance it has got. With 6 gb ram and exynos 7885 octa core processor it is like a flagship.
2. The display. Super amoled display is always crisp and great and it has the same.
3. Fast charging. It really does the trick. To get from 2% to 100% charge it takes about 1 hour.
4. It is splash proof. To test I have splashed a whole mug of water on the phone. It is fine as promised.
5. Stunning look. It has glass on both side and the look and feel of the model is awesome. People often will think about it as Galaxy note 8.
6. Dual VOLTE. It has dual VOLTE support. That means if you are using one jio sim and other vodafone/airtel, you can use data from Vodafone/airtel and still Jio will be working.
7. Dedicated sd slot. It has 2 sim slots and one dedicated micro sd card slot.
8. It is Dolby supported. So if you have a good headset you will get very good and clear sound.
Cons:
1. Battery could have been better. With 6" display and super amoled it lasts about 10 hours with heavy usage.
2. No front flash. Dual camera is present on the front so you will get the boke mode.
3. No dual camera on the rear. At this price range it should have been provided.
4. Sometime the phone feels heavy a bit. It is over 190gms.
Verdict: If camera is not your first priority, great performance with little bit of compromise with battery is not an issue for you you can surely go for it. I bought it on sale @Rs.21000+ and it is worth that.

Overall if you are normal user and not than much photogenic or selfie freak you are not going to regret it. Its a good phone after all. I am totally safisfied with it. It only there would have been wireless charging support it would be a killer.

reviews_name: A nice "SAMSUNG" Phone with many qualities but some CONS too!
reviews_text:
Being its MASSIVE user since several MONTHS, I would like to share my experiences with this phone over time:-
1) Design- GREAT, but you would need a CASE and a Tempered GLASS over as the back can get cracked on dropping the phone easily.
2) Sound- ABOVE Average, easily hearable outdoors......and also with the new update, it has dolby support for microphones use which is quite good.
3) Display- Great with nice viewing angles....easily visible outdoors so no complaints.
4) Performance- Day to day general performance is good. NOT for HEAVY GAMERS of PUBG type games. Medium graphics games will run fine though. Samsung UI might be a reason for it
5) RAM- 6gb enough for day to day usage...ram management is good but the 6gb ram is DDR3 not DDR4.....I mean SERIOUSLY??? And ya it does sometimes (rare times) lags. Heavy samsung UI might be a reason for it
6) Storage- 64gb with expandable memory card slot.....what else do you need?
7) CAMERA- Rear camera is with whom I am FULLY SATISFIED. No complaints. Front camera is great also but low-light front camera shots are above average. Videos also come out above average from both.
8) Battery- good for average user. Average for heavy users. But since it has got power saving modes which are good.....so no issues with battery life
9) Software- Feature rich with lesser bloatware as compared to previous samsung phones. So no complaints with that.
10) Security- FP sensor has improved with updates......face recognition NOT RELIABLE.
Other PROS include Dual 4G Volte, Notification light, all sensors present including gyroscope , Always ON display, seperate sim slots and micro SD card slot, IP68 rating, Bixby Vision, Samsung pay......etc.etc.
Here are some CONS though to look out for:-
1) No 5GHZ wifi band support which is sad.
2) EIS for videos is not that good
3) No slow motion video recording option
4) Speaker quality on max. volume could have been improved. Or they should have given dual speakers like C9 Pro..!
5) Gaming performance MUST be improvedüò°
6) Better battery optimisation should be done
7) Minor system UI lags must be resolved with an OTA update
8) Front camera low light quality and both cam's video quality must be improved.
9) No 4k recording at this price
10) Bixby voice could have been a plus
11) No dual LED for rear cam. Only single LED flash.
Overall a nice phone which should be improved with updates more!!üòä
Extraordinary product better than any other china phones highly worth of money.

reviews_name: Pretty decent for an average customer. Lags while playing heavy games like pubg on max settings.
reviews_text:
Posting this review after 3 months of heavy usage.
Pros:
1. Magnificiet battery life. Goes from 0-100% in about 1.5 hours through fast charging.
2. Large, bright, colourful screen.
3. Ram management is very good(6 gbs of ram).
4. Sound quality is pretty decent, on a scale of 0-10, would give a 9.
5. Dual front camera is very good, but hey who takes selfie all day in the time of dslrs?
6. Fingerprint scanner and face recognition is good and flawless, though it lacks an iris scanner.
7. Looks very decent with that glass back.
Cons:
1. Can not play heavy games like pubg in max graphics, but runs smoothly on lower selections of graphics.
2. The processor for the money I paid is pretty old. Add a few thousand extra bucks and get a One plus 6 instead.
3. Back camera: 16 megapixles performs decent, but lacks a bit in the generation of dual cameras.
Conclusion: If you aren't a heavy user and want decent performance in every field and also the Samsung user interface in this price range, go for it. Though would suggest the huawei honor 10 or the view 10 if you don't want the samsung UI. Both are of the same price.
And if you're looking for top notch experience, adding a few thousand bucks and getting the 0ne plus 6, won't do any harm.
Cheers!

reviews_name: A phone with compromised camera and processor.. An insult to its pricing
reviews_text:
Many has praised this phone enough. Now it's time to criticise when you spend 31.5k on a phone instead of typical 20 to 25k I usually spend. I will mostly talk about day to day problems which matters most to everyone. I was in dire need of a decent camera phone for my upcoming travel then. The 6 gb ram and dual selfie made me buy this phone, I also simply expected that rear camera, my primary need, would be without problems. Well this is where Samsung screwed up which still bothers me until today.
CAMERA:
The front and rear camera both do not have Optical Image Sensor and therefore all those people who do not have very stable hand will suffer from blur photographs and even more blur in low light. Not to me but blur selfies can be even more insulting with a group and a big let down for selfie enthusiasts. In my recent travel, even after due care while taking pictures, 10% of the total pictures from my bulk are still blur and I have yet to delete them from the gallery. Writing this after 2 months seriously this phone's rear camera sucks big time. Many photos taken are blur especially when taken by someone like my mother. Lack of OIS reflects in your daily photography headache. Shame for its price, this phone does not deserve the value they took from the customers. This is some kind of loot in the name of big screen and glass body. After contacting Samsung, they are replying with their stupid templates as if there is no human to understand and accept the problem.
PROCESSOR:
Yon know Samsung UI. It is a blessing and headache at the same time. Thanks to Android hunger for RAM and Samsung contribution in further exploitation of the same. There are lot of Samsung apps which are not useful for everyone which needs RAM and processor usage in the background. Samsung do not care and they still stuff the crap up the phone's throat. As you know Samsung believe in giving quantity instead of quality just like they launch a new phone model every quarter. They could not control ram usage so they gave 6 gb ram. Thank god! I would never buy a Samsung's true smartphone with 4 gb ram. But even after giving 6 gb ram Samsung still screwed up here as well by using some low end processor found in cheaper phones. The 2 year old s7 still leads in benchmarking against this phone. Do check processor specs before you buy this phone. That is why the not so fast processor chipset heats up the phone when I use GPS and stream music via bluetooth at the same time in the car. It is simply because the low power processor used is unable to give enough power to modern OS resulting in overload on the whole chipset and therefore more heat to cope up. Another shame it is!
SPEAKER:
I need to watch video sometimes for learnings and entertainment but the speaker volume is not enough for outdoors. For indoor it is ok but not acceptable for this class of phone. No dolby and loudness enhancement to fix this. Another backward hardware it is.
MISC:
There is no wireless charging. Screen glass & back is not much scratch resistant, I already see micro scratches caused from the in-box provided case. World is moving to shock proof screens and I expect at least a better gorilla glass here if they have gone for glass body. Samsung did not share the type of glass used in their spec sheet. Its also a fingerprint magnet.
My mistake is I did not do enough research on specs of camera and processor and bought it too soon on launch. At this price point such blunders are not acceptable, but Samsung is Samsung.
Three less stars for three big problems mentioned above.
I would not criticize about big form factor, low screen resolution or phone still on nougat because I already knew that. If anyone is a Samsung fan and need a good budget phone today then they should go for Samsung S7 which is still a very good camera phone with surprisingly better processor & screen than this phone at much cheaper price.

reviews_name: The Galaxy A8+ is good ‚Äî just not as good as other devices in this category.
reviews_text:
We'll get to how Samsung is responding to Xiaomi's threat in a few weeks' time, but for now, it's time to take a look at how the company is gunning after OnePlus with its latest device in the Galaxy A series. This is the Galaxy A8+ 2018.
I (Kshitiz) am writing this review after using the Galaxy A8+ as my daily driver for over two weeks in Hyderabad, India. The unit was provided by Samsung India, and was connected to Airtel's 4G network for the duration of the review. The device picked up a single software update with stability fixes and the January 1, 2018 security patch
GALAXY A8+ SPECS:
Operating System : Android 7.1.1 Nougat
Samsung Experience: 8.5
Display: 6.0-inch Super AMOLED 1080 x 2220 (411ppi)
Corning Gorilla Glass
Processor: Exynos 7885 Octa
2 x 2.2GHz Cortex A73, 6 x 1.6GHz Cortex A53
14nm FinFET
GPU: Mali-G71
RAM: 6GB
Storage: 64GB
Expandable: Yes, up to 256GB (dedicated slot)
Battery: 3500mAh
Charging: USB-C
Rear Camera: 16MP f/1.7, PDAF
1080p@30FPS
Front Camera; 16MP + 8MP, f/1.9
1080p video
Connectivity: Wi-Fi 802.11 ac, Bluetooth 5.0
FM radio, 3.5mm jack
GPS/AGPS, GLONASS
Security: One-touch fingerprint sensor at the back
Iris scanning
SIM: Dual SIM slot
Dimensions: 159.9 x 75.7 x 8.3mm
191g
Colors: Black, Gold
With the Galaxy A8+, Samsung is bringing over its Infinity Display design aesthetic over to the mid-range segment. Like the S8 series and the Note 8, the A8+ has an 18.5:9 panel with narrow bezels, but there are a few differences. First up, the display itself is FHD+ and not QHD+ like the flagships, and the panel isn't curved. So the overall effect isn't quite as breathtaking as what you'd get on the Note 8.
The A8+ has provision for two SIM cards and a microSD slot, but instead of a single SIM card tray, you get two. The slot for the first SIM card is located to the right of the device, and the tray for the secondary SIM card and the microSD slot is at the top of the phone. The overall design certainly won't turn any heads (let's call it Infinity Display Lite), but the A8+ still comes across as a premium device.
Galaxy A8+ Software:
For a device releasing in January 2018, it's inexcusable that the A8+ comes with Android 7.1.1 Nougat out of the box. It's possible that Samsung is saving the Oreo build for the Galaxy S9, which is set to make its debut on February 26. As a result, what we have with the A8+ is a software experience that should be immediately familiar if you've used a Samsung device in 2017.
And considering just how long it takes Samsung to roll out an update, it's entirely likely the Oreo update won't be available for the device until the next quarter (if not longer). Samsung has to contend with hundreds of regional variants and carrier models when it comes to platform updates, so it's understandable that they take time.
But there's nothing stopping the company from launching a new device with the latest version of Android, particularly when you consider that the first developer build for Oreo rolled out over ten months ago.
Should you buy it ‚ùìA BIG NO‚ùå‚ùå
Aside from the fact that it runs Nougat out of the box, there's nothing particularly wrong with the Galaxy A8+. In fact, it's clear that the A8+ is the best device in the Galaxy A series thus far. However, while the South Korean manufacturer was perfecting its model for an affordable flagship, other brands haven't been idle.
The Galaxy A8+ retails for ‚Çπ32,999 ($520) in India, putting it squarely in the crosshairs of the OnePlus 5T, which costs exactly the same. The Mi Mix 2 is also on sale for the same price, so there certainly isn't a dearth of choice here.

reviews_name: The pros are 1) Excellent display. Really stands out 2) Great build quality ...
reviews_text:
The pros are
1) Excellent display. Really stands out
2) Great build quality which gives the phone a premium feel.
3) Excellent sound quality
4) Capable camera hardware
5) Really useful software features from Samsung which includes direct call (auto call the contact when you get the phone near your ears) , live adjust for apps to fit 18:9 display, lot of battery power optimization options.
6) Produces excellent close up shots like the one attached
Areas of improvement
1) Live focus is a hit and miss scenario. You can take really good photos if you act like a pro or in ideal conditions. Definitely needs software update in terms of stabilization and processing. If you dont keep your hands steady, you and up with blurred photos even in good lighting.
2) Placement of figure print scanner is still not ideal. It should have been a bit more lower. This is still manageable as you get used to.
3) Improvements are required for facial recognition as well.
4) Missing android Oreo and we are in 2018.
5) Pictures taken are very bad and really disappoinitng to the extent that I feel even a budget phone could take better pictures. Hoping an update will improve this as the hardware is capable. The phone gives an oil painting effect to all photos which is very annoying and there is no raw image format support. Will give a 5 star if this is improved and I expect drastic improvements because the camera hardware is capable and in fact is the same as that is available on Oneplus5T. Only hope is that I have already received 2 updates till date. So I guess Samsung is working on overall improvements.
CONS:
1) Experiencing battery drainage. Lost 40% of charge without any use from previous night to next day morning.
Things to note
1) People should be ready to move away from single handed operations specially those who are migrating from 5.5" form factor phones. The phone is handy but definitely not for single handed operations in most scenarios
